Dear Adriene,

I am leaving my mat in tears today.
In March/Apríl, I was doing Home with you. We were locked in quarantine in the Czech republic back then. I was practicing Home with my best friend, also doing some wim hof practices, walking up an old Celtic pagan hill in my neighbourhood. I was joking all the time that what I was doing felt like magic. That I have no idea where its going to take me. I have done Yoga before, I have been doing it since on and off as well, but that time felt different.
Well, the next month after Home, they called me from the social services. They had a baby boy for me to adopt. To take home.

Fast forward, here I am, with him at home already for so many months, finalising my court application to have it all done. I had to do so much paperwork, not to freak out so much. I felt like I was going to go crazy.
I needed so much breath. You gave me all of it.
The application is sent, accepted, the only thing I am waiting for is the final court date.
Maybe some small changed will happen too, but I am a peaceful warrior.

You have the biggest Namaste from me. Ever.

I found Yoga with Adrianne several years ago and she is the one that has inspired me to really get into my daily practice. For years I WANTED to do yoga but at the time was too focused on the hardcore, fast pace, push your body to the limit and feel it for a week at a time type of movement. Honestly at the time I really didn't respect my body, I just wanted to acceive that perfect shape.

But I finally came into yoga, and truely surrendered to it when I was going through some tough times in my life about 3-4 years ago and it honestly has brought me home to myself. Instead of seeing my body as something I have to fight with to get it to do what I want it to do, I see it as an outward reflection of what is going on inside myself. It is mearly a part of me (body/mind/spirit) and all areas have to be harmonious to bring you well being.

For the last 2 years I have pretty well practiced yoga DAILY and I LOVE it! I truely crave it. Without having any expectations of how hard I have to work or how flexible i need to get or how many calories I need to burn. I just get on the mat and move and LISTEN! It is like therapy for me.
